io.nats.client

Interface Connection

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AbstractConnection, AutoCloseable

    public interface Connection
extends AbstractConnection
    A Connection object is a client's active connection to a NATS server.

    To connect to a NATS server using the default URL: 

         Connection nc = Nats.connect();

    To connect to a NATS server using a custom URL: 

         Connection nc = Nats.connect("nats://someserver:4222");

    To connect to a NATS server using a custom URL list: 

         Connection nc = Nats.connect("nats://someserver:4222, nats://anotherserver:4222");

    To connect to a NATS server using a custom URL and other custom options: 

         Connection nc = Nats.connect("nats://someserver:4222", new Options.Builder()
             .dontRandomize()
             .maxReconnect(1)
             .reconnectWait(200)
             .build());

      • publish

        void publish(String subject,
             byte[] data)
      throws IOException
        Publishes the payload specified by data to the subject specified by subject.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to publish the message to
        data - the message payload
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error is encountered

      • publish

        void publish(Message msg)
      throws IOException
        Publishes a message to a subject. The subject is set via Message.setSubject(String) or the Message.Message(String, String, byte[]) constructor.
        Parameters:
        msg - the Message to publish
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error is encountered

      • publish

        void publish(String subject,
             String reply,
             byte[] data)
      throws IOException
        Publishes the payload specified by data to the subject specified by subject, with an optional reply subject. If reply is null, the behavior is identical to publish(String, byte[])
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to publish the message to
        reply - the subject to which subscribers should send responses
        data - the message payload
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error is encountered

      • publish

        void publish(String subject,
             String reply,
             byte[] data,
             boolean flush)
      throws IOException
        Publishes the payload specified by data to the subject specified by subject, with an optional reply subject. If reply is null, the behavior is identical to publish(String, byte[]). if flush is true, a flush of the Connection's output stream will be forced.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to publish the message to
        reply - the subject to which subscribers should send responses
        data - the message payload
        flush - whether to force a flush of the output stream
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error is encountered

      • request

        Message request(String subject,
                byte[] data,
                long timeout)
         throws IOException,
                InterruptedException
        Publishes a request message to the specified subject, waiting up to timeout msec for a response.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to publish the request message to
        data - the request message payload
        timeout - how long to wait for a response message (in msec)
        Returns:
        the response message, or null if timed out
        Throws:
        IOException - if a connection-related error occurs
        InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting to receive a response

      • request

        Message request(String subject,
                byte[] data,
                long timeout,
                TimeUnit unit)
         throws IOException,
                InterruptedException
        Publishes a request message to the specified subject, waiting up to timeout msec for a response.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to publish the request message to
        data - the request message payload
        timeout - how long to wait for a response message (in msec)
        unit - how long to wait for a response message (in msec)
        Returns:
        the response message, or null if timed out
        Throws:
        IOException - if a connection-related error occurs
        InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting to receive a response

      • request

        Message request(String subject,
                byte[] data)
         throws IOException,
                InterruptedException
        Publishes a request message to the specified subject, waiting for a response until one is available.
        Parameters:
        subject - the subject to publish the request message to
        data - the request message payload
        Returns:
        the response message, or null if timed out
        Throws:
        IOException - if a connection-related error occurs
        InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting to receive a response
